snippet: About 130 people had gathered in East Flatbush and were marching toward the 67th Police Precinct station house when about two dozen protesters splintered off and grew rowdy.
abstract: Vigil for Kimani Gray, armed Brooklyn teenager who was fatally shot by police officers, turns violent when a small group breaks off from gathering and begins throwing bottles at local police precinct station house in East Flatbush.

byline.contributor: Michael Schwirtz and Tim Stelloh contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: About 130 people had gathered in East Flatbush and were marching toward the 67th Police Precinct station house when about two dozen protesters splintered off and grew rowdy.

headline.seo: Violence Breaks Out in Brooklyn at Vigil for Teenager Shot by the Police
headline.main: Vigil for Brooklyn Teenager Fatally Shot by the Police Turns Violent
headline.print_headline: Brooklyn Vigil For Teenager Turns Violent
